items.title: Trump tells Iranians 'help is on its way' amid deadly protests
items.description: A human rights agency and an Iranian official both say around 2,000 people have been killed in protests against the country's ruling Islamic regime.

items.title: What videos out of Iran tell us about the spread of the protests
items.description: The first embers of the Iranian protests started in a mobile phone market, spreading to every corner of the country as the Revolutionary Guard struggled to regain control.

items.title: The man cops overlooked in Eloise Worledge disappearance
items.description: As police up the reward to $1 million for information that will lead to the remains of missing school girl Eloise Worledge, questions remain about why police disregarded a known rapist in their investigation.

items.title: Victoria's bushfires more than five times the size of Singapore
items.description: Victoria's bushfires have now burnt across 404,000 hectares, or a total area more than five times the size of Singapore.

items.title: Liberals divided over Labor's plan to outlaw inciting racial hatred
items.description: After weeks criticising the Albanese government over the Bondi attack and issues around antisemitism, the Coalition is split over whether proposed solutions are at odds with its interests in preserving freedom of speech.

items.title: Louise Adler unloads over reputationally 'trashed' Adelaide Writers' Week
items.description: The former Adelaide Writers' Week director takes aim at lobby groups and the SA premier during an intense appearance on 7.30 in which she says the event's reputation has been "trashed".

items.title: 'We don't want them': Neo-Nazi group says it will disband ahead of new laws
items.description: In a statement posted to Telegram, the group announced the closure of the National Socialist Network would also spell the end of "co-projects" White Australia, the European Australian Movement and the White Australia Party.

items.title: Clintons refuse to testify for US House Epstein investigation
items.description: Republicans in the US House say they could commence contempt of Congress proceedings against the former president and former Democratic presidential nominee.

items.title: Russia's nuclear-capable hypersonic missile a new dilemma for NATO
items.description: Analysts say Russia's new Oreshnik hypersonic missile will continues to pose challenges for NATO after Moscow used the weapon for a second time in Ukraine.

items.title: Prosecutors seek death penalty for ex-South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol
items.description: Yoon Suk Yeol faces several criminal charges related to his call to impose martial law and other criminal cases related to his time in office.

items.title: Online retailer accused of trying to profit from Bondi massacre
items.description: An online fashion retailer accused of "unconscionable conduct" has been investigated for profiting off the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Author Craig Silvey not cooperating with authorities after arrest, court told
items.description: One of Australia's most renowned authors, Craig Silvey, faces court after he allegedly distributed child exploitation material.

items.title: Michele Bullock joins global central bankers' support of US Fed chief facing Trump probe
items.description: Twelve central bankers, including Australia's Reserve Bank governor Michele Bullock, have signed a letter in support of Mr Powell, who is set to face a criminal investigation in the US.

items.title: The sort of world in which Rudd has lived most of his career is now gone
items.description: One month after Kevin Rudd leaves his post as Australia's ambassador to Washington, Donald Trump will make his first presidential visit to China in almost 10 years.

items.title: Ukraine hit by almost 300 drones, Volodymyr Zelenskyy says
items.description: Four people have been killed in the latest strikes by Russia that have mainly targeted the power grid.

items.title: BBC seeks to have Donald Trump's $15b defamation lawsuit dismissed
items.description: The BBC is attempting to dismiss the US president lawsuit over its editing of a 2021 speech that made it appear he had directed supporters to storm the US Capitol.

items.title: Is hyaluronic acid all hype? We look at the science
items.description: While hyaluronic acid is a common component of our skin and tissue and is marketed as a way to boost hydration, its skin benefits are more complicated than it appears.

items.title: Woman behind crepe attack on chief minister sentenced in court
items.description: The woman who assaulted a former Northern Territory chief minister with a cream crepe is sentenced to 12 months imprisonment, fully suspended.

items.title: Chaos in court as man accused of assaulting Muslim leader is denied bail
items.description: A Melbourne courtroom descended into chaos as the 23-year-old man accused of assaulting Ismet Purdic and his wife attempted to climb out of the dock moments after being denied bail.

items.title: Retired navy captain Mark Kelly sues the Pentagon over free speech
items.description: The US Democratic senator alleges the president and defense secretary are trying to intimidate him into silence for comments he made in a video calling on serving troops to defy illegal orders.

items.title: 'Camper' who deliberately lit Royal National Park fires likely to be jailed
items.description: A magistrate tells a 48-year-old bus driver prison is his "only possible sentence" after he lit two small fires near Sydney in December.

items.title: 'How can I make my body look like that?' Inside the pressures facing elite female athletes
items.description: Throughout her career, former ice dancer Matilda Friend struggled with disordered eating and felt pressure to look a certain way. ABC's Women's Sport survey shows she isn't the only one.

items.title: Details of sweeping changes to hate speech and gun laws revealed
items.description: Directly quoting from a religious text for the purpose of teaching or discussion may provide a defence under the federal government's hate speech laws proposed in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: 'I do my best to settle my conscience': SA premier becomes emotional at press conference
items.description: Peter Malinauskas becomes tearful during a media conference where he faces extensive questions about the crisis surrounding Adelaide Writers' Week and allegations of homophobia against Adelaide United made by former player Josh Cavallo.

items.title: Markets shudder as White House goes to war with everyone
items.description: In the past week, the US has dramatically expanded and accelerated its attacks both inside and outside its borders. Here's where Australia stands in the fray.
